column4: Someone correct me if I'm wrong, but wouldn't that command the TuxOtaku mentioned actually be safe? /dev/null doesn't contain anything, and so dd would stop after 0 bytes... it's /dev/zero that would wipe a hard drive.
you are right, it was a bad joke @ reboot question
if it is a sata disk, xp won't work, ..
that will give problems with win7/vista, i presume
